author: BBC News
description:
Greater Manchester Police have said they believe the synagogue attacker is 35-year-old Jihad Al-Shamie, a British citizen of Syrian descent.

Police said based on what officers currently know, police records do not show any previous referrals for the individual to the counter-terror Prevent scheme.

Two men are dead and three are in hospital with "serious injuries" after a man drove a car at members of the public before stabbing people.

The incident comes on Yom Kippur - the holiest day in the Jewish religious calendar.

Police shot the attacker dead within seven minutes of the first 999 call - officers later made three other arrests.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Manchester #BBCNews
title: Manchester police name synagogue attacker as two men confirmed dead | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Today, an attack on a synagogue in Manchester has been declared a terrorist incident by counter-terror police. 

Members of Manchester’s Jewish Community were worshipping at the Heaton Park synagogue on Yom Kippur, the holiest day in the Jewish calendar, when the attacker rammed a car and carried out a knife attack. Adam is joined by BBC News Correspondent Danny Savage, who has been on the scene in Manchester today.

Plus, Adam speaks to Zack Polanski, leader of the Green Party of England and Wales, ahead of their party conference in Bournemouth this weekend. Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: What we know about the Manchester Synagogue attack | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
description:
A year after winning a record six Brit Awards in a single night, singer Raye still worries about the precarious nature of success.
 
It doesn't help that she's been scarred by her past experiences with a record label that, for almost a decade, pushed her into making generic dance records while refusing to release her debut album.
 
Here, she talks to BBC music correspondent Mark Savage about her new hit Where Is My Husband! and her five-year plan.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Raye #Music #BBCNews
title: Raye on Where Is My Husband! and her five-year plan | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
The deadly attack on a synagogue in Manchester has been declared a terrorist incident.

Two people died in the car and stabbing attack, while four others are in hospital.

Police said the attacker was stopped from entering the synagogue by the bravery of security staff and worshippers - he was shot dead within seven minutes of the first 999 call.

Meanwhile, counter-terror officers say they believe they know the identity of the attacker and two other people have been arrested.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: Two members of Manchester's Jewish community die in synagogue attack | BBC News

title: What we know so far about the Manchester synagogue attack. #Manchester #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
An ice core that may be older than 1.5 million years is being melted down by scientists to unlock vital information about Earth's climate.
 
The glassy cylinder is the planet's oldest ice and was drilled from deep inside the Antarctic ice sheet.
 
Frozen inside is thousands of years of new information that scientists say could "revolutionise" what we know about climate change.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: World's oldest Antarctic ice being melted to find out more about climate | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Police say four people have been injured in an attack at a synagogue in Manchester, England.
 
The suspect has been shot by police, with Greater Manchester Mayor Andy Burnham saying the suspect is believed to be dead.

The incident comes on Yom Kippur - the holiest day in the Jewish religious calendar.

title: Four people injured in car and stabbing attack at Manchester synagogue | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Police are treating the attack at a synagogue in Manchester as a terrorist incident.
 
Two people died after the car and stabbing attack, the suspect died after being shot by police. Three other people are in a serious condition.
 
The incident occurred on Yom Kippur - the holiest day in the Jewish religious calendar.

title: LIVE: Police treating Manchester synagogue attack in which two died as terror incident | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
London’s Metropolitan Police chief Sir Mark Rowley has spoken to the BBC, after a Panorama investigation found misogyny and racism inside his force.
 
He says the behaviour uncovered in Charing Cross station is "reprehensible" and says he wants people "off the payroll".
 
He insists the force is better than three years ago, but accepts there is still "cancer" to be removed.
 
The behaviour uncovered by Panorama is "shocking" and that Rowley needs to be "very robust" in his response, UK PM Keir Starmer said.
 
The secret filming showed officers making sexualised comments to colleagues and sharing racist views about immigrants and Muslims.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#MetPolice #London #BBCNews
title: London’s Met chief speaks after secret filming exposes officers' misogyny and racism | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
The Israeli navy has intercepted boats carrying aid to Gaza and detained the activists aboard, including Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg.
 
Israel's Foreign Ministry said several vessels that form part of the Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF) had been "safely stopped" and that those aboard were being transferred to an Israeli port.
 
It added the navy had told the vessels to change course as they were "approaching an active combat zone".
 
The GSF has said boats are still being intercepted on Thursday morning. Earlier, it said 30 boats were still "sailing strong to Gaza" and were 46 nautical miles from their intended destination.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Gaza #Israel #BBCNews
title: Israeli navy intercepts activist boats carrying aid to Gaza | BBC News
